Ortet.title: Six Realms
Ortet.about:
SIX REALMS 

Different forms of existence we can take upon rebirth, or psychological states we experience in our current life in the human realm.



HIGHER REALMS

GOD blissful, ethereal, supremely contented—oblivious to the suffering of others.

DEMIGOD ego, aggression, jealousy—warring gods (asuras) striving to rise in power & position.

HUMAN passionate, perceptive, experiencing many states of mind—able to free themselves from samsara, the cycle of death & rebirth.



LOWER REALMS

ANIMAL a life of ignorant complacency & dullness—unable to look beyond avoiding pain & seeking comfort.

HUNGRY GHOST pretas have big bellies & tiny mouths—incalculably frustrated by desires they cannot fulfill.

HELL a claustrophobic place of extreme heat or cold—the inescapable torment of one's own intense anger & hatred.



composed by MARTY BELCHER

performed by ORTET
Ortet.credits:
released June 22, 2022
            
            Marty Belcher: reeds, bowls, fx

Tony Brewer: sharkey, rulers, bells, bowls, spoken word

Norbert Herber: reeds, samples, electronics

Chris Rall: reeds, lap steel, theremin, turntable, piano

Joe MF Stone: drums, glockenspiel, samples

+ guest spoken word by Joan Hawkins



Recorded, mixed & mastered by Mike Bridavsky at Russian Recording in Bloomington, Indiana



© 2022 Urban Deer Record Co.  

urban-deer.com



 Package art by David Ebbinghouse

Ortet.title: We ❤️ LA
Ortet.about:
Recorded 2 February, 2025 at Urban Deer HQ. 

Friday, February 7th—from midnight to midnight PST—100% of Bandcamp’s proceeds will be donated to MusiCares to support those affected by the recent Southern California wildfires. MusiCares offers preventive, emergency, and recovery programs, and is a safety net supporting the health and welfare of the music community. 

Regardless of the date, Ortet will also donate all proceeds from this recording to MusiCares.
Ortet.credits:
released February 7, 2025

Chris Rall: Alto saxophone

Ortet.title: 27 FIGMENTS for small ensemble
Ortet.about: 27 Figments for Small Ensemble is a series of micro-compositions that explore texture, tonality, and timbre through varying combinations of musicians and instrumentation. Each Figment captures a distinct mood or phonic quality, creating a mosaic of fleeting sonic impressions. This invites the listener to engage with the space between the notes, where silence and resonance become as essential as sound itself. The images are sounds visualized through a cymatic process. We listened to each Figment not only with our ears but with equations as well. We mapped their dominant frequencies through spectral analysis, then transformed those sounds into shapes, etching invisible music onto an imagined Chladni plate. What emerged are the delicate scars of resonance: dark fields where the plate would have trembled most and pale filaments tracing the stillness between. In the physical world, this would be done with grains of sand dancing on metal to the push and pull of sound. Here, it’s a synthesis born of Chladni’s laws and the spectral fingerprints left by each Figment.
Ortet.credits:
released May 21, 2025
            
            Marty Belcher: Soprano saxophone, percussion

Tony Brewer: Foley effects table, Sharky's Machine

Norbert Herber: Bass clarinet, electronics

Chris Rall: Alto saxophone, piano

Joe MF Stone: Drums



Recorded, mixed, and mastered by Mike Bridavsky at Russian Recording in Bloomington, Indiana



artwork by Chris Rall

package design by Tony Brewer



© 2025 Urban Deer Record Co.

Ortet.title: Festive AF in December 2024
Ortet.about:
Yes, it is a bit of a meme—free improv *can* kill the mood at a festive gathering. But the essence of improv truly captures the spirit of the late December holiday season. This music depends upon people who can come together to share in a tradition rooted in selflessness. A playing session is all about listening, generosity, open communication, and the celebration of togetherness. Few things in life are more merry, jolly, and bright.



Recorded 1, 8, and 15 December 2024 at Urban Deer HQ.
Ortet.credits:
released December 20, 2024
            
            Marty Belcher: soprano saxophone, Line 6 effects + looper 

Tony Brewer: Foley effects table, Sharky's Machine 

Norbert Herber: Bass clarinet, electronics 

Chris Rall: Turntable, piano

Joe MF Stone: Drums

Ortet.title: Shark Smile (excerpt)
Ortet.about:
Recorded 18 July 2024 at Backspace Gallery in Bloomington, IN. 

This excerpt features Ortet (credits below) with Joan Hawkins reading her work "Shark Smile."

The entire performance was released by Marjorie Van Halteren of the Electroacoustical Poetical Society to celebrate "Strange Music Day" on August 26, 2024. Listen at  eaps.mixlr.com/recordings/2532889

 Backspace Gallery (Undecet), featured ORTET (credits below) with guest players David Miller, trumpet; Kyle Quass, trumpet; Richard Jermain, cybernetic guitar; and featuring Brian Price, keyboard and effects on “Key Bridge #1”; Joan Hawkins, voice on “Shark Smile”; and Marjorie Van Halteren, voice, harmonica, Orba on “Can’t Draw, Can’t Paint”.
Ortet.credits:
released August 28, 2024
                        
                    
                

                Marty Belcher, saxophones and live processing
Chris Rall, saxophones, turntable, piano, lap steel, modular synth
Joe MF Stone, drums, samples, voice
Norbert Herber, woodwinds and electronics
Tony Brewer, sharky, foley table, voice
Joan Hawkins, voice

Ortet.title: Many vocalizations (et compte en français)
Ortet.about: Bandmates were greeted this week by the neighborhood goose—a warning to all in the area that *something weird was about to happen.* We don't think it likes our music. Thankfully our primary patrons are human, feline, and canine. Perhaps we'll appeal to the Anatid crowd in the future? It's good to have aspirations.
Ortet.credits:
released January 26, 2023
                        
                    
                

                Recorded 22 January with Marty, Tony, Norbert, Chris, Joe MF Stone; with guests Joan Hawkins (voice) & David Miller (trumpet).

Ortet.title: Live at the Blockhouse (9 Nov. 2022)
Ortet.about:
Recorded at the Blockhouse during the "Six Realms" release party. Marty, Tony, Norbert, Chris, Joe; with special guests David Miller & Kyle Quass.

We worked with a lot of structure that night. But for this final piece of the night we just played. Check out Chris in tenor beast mode with no neck strap; horn balanced on table!
Ortet.credits: released November 16, 2022

Ortet.title: Live at Backspace 16 Dec. 2022
Ortet.about:
Recorded at Backspace Gallery on 16 December, 2022. Marty, Tony, Norbert, Chris, Joe MF Stone.

2022 was marked by the release of “Six Realms” and guest performances with some truly talented artists. Our thanks to:
Michaël Attias
Jaap Blonk
Richard Bonnet
Sylvain Darrifourcq
Phillip Greenlief
Joan Hawkins
David Miller
Pdvnch
Brooke Nicole Plummer
Kyle Quass 
Josh Sinton
Damon Smith

What a group of exceptional human beings! It was an honor and privilege to share performances with you. See you in 2023!
Ortet.credits: released December 24, 2022
